details.purpose: Recording of findings on inspection of nails
details.use: For use with the exam clusters for recording findings on inspection
details.misuse: Should only be used in the exam observation

items.items: The crescent shaped whitish area of the nail bed (when visible)
Fold of hard skin overlapping the base and sides of a fingernail or toenail.
Loss of normal 160° angle at base of nail
Is the nail plate intact or damaged/breached by trauma etc
Findings about the nail plate - the hard and translucent portion of the nail, composed of keratin.
# nail bed is the adherent connective tissue that underlies the nail.
# eponychium or cuticle, is the fold of skin at the proximal end of the nail.
# hyponychium is the attachment between the skin of the finger or toe and the distal end of the nail.
# lunula is the crescent shaped whitish area of the nail bed (when visible)
The fold of skin at the proximal end of the nail.
The fold of skin on the sides of the nail.
The attachment between the skin of the finger or toe and the distal end of the nail.
The findings on physical examination by inspection
An optional group of statements about the normality of the inspection
A specific statement about the normality of inspection
The shape or distribution of the object inspected
Description of the location of the findings
Description of immediate surrounds to object eg skin nailbed and nailfold
Findings about the edge of the object under inspection
The nature of the edge of the object of examination
The edge is defined but less clear in places
The edge is not defined clearly in many places
Description of the edge or border of the object of inspection
Is the object of inspection translucent?
The colour of the object under inspection
Clinical description of the findings on inspection
Detailed examination of a finding on inspection
A drawing of the findings on inspection
The contour of the object of inspection
